text: Phthalimidoperoxycaproic acid (ε- or 6-(phthalimido)peroxyhexanoic acid, abbreviated as PAP) is a synthetic organic peroxy acid derived from caproic acid and phthalimide. The compound is mainly used as bleaching activator, alternatively or in association to hydrogen peroxide, in moderate laundry conditions. It is also described as tooth whitening agent. In room conditions, PAP is a white odorless crystalline powder, slightly soluble in water and strongly oxidizer. == References == Category:Peroxy acids Category:Phthalimides
